    • Method Detail

      • parseConfig

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseConfig(java.io.File configFile,
                                                                               java.lang.String separate,
                                                                               java.lang.String comment)
                                                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Parse a configuration file into a HashMap of values and keys. Ignores comments and blank lines, as well as comments.
        Parameters:
        configFile - - the configuration File
        separate - - the String in the configuration File that separates the key from the value, such as ":"
        comment - - the String in the configuration File that is used to start a comment, such as "#"
        Returns:
        the HashMap of all keys and values from the configuration file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading the configuration File fails

      • addField

        public static void addField(java.io.File configFile,
                            java.lang.String field,
                            java.lang.String value,
                            java.lang.String separate,
                            java.lang.String comment)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a field (key) and value to config
        Parameters:
        configFile - - the configuration File
        field - - the field to add
        value - - the value to add along with the field
        separate - - the String in the configuration File that separates the key from the value, such as ":"
        comment - - the String in the configuration File that is used to start a comment, such as "#"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading or writing the configuration File fails

      • removeField

        public static void removeField(java.io.File configFile,
                               java.lang.String field,
                               java.lang.String separate,
                               java.lang.String comment)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Remove field (key) and value from a configuration File
        Parameters:
        configFile - - the configuration File
        field - - the field to remove from the configuration File
        separate - - the String in the configuration File that separates the key from the value, such as ":"
        comment - - the String in the configuration File that is used to start a comment, such as "#"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading or writing the configuration File fails

                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> map,
                                java.lang.String separate)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Create configuration File from a Map
        Parameters:
        configFile - - the configuration File
        map - - the Map to generate the configuration File from
        separate - - the String in the configuration File that separates the key from the value, such as ":"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if writing the configuration File fails

      • changeValue

        public static void changeValue(java.io.File configFile,
                               java.lang.String field,
                               java.lang.String value,
                               java.lang.String separate,
                               java.lang.String comment)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Change the value of a field (key)
        Parameters:
        configFile - - the configuration File
        field - - the field to change the value of
        value - - the value to apply to the field
        separate - - the String in the configuration File that separates the key from the value, such as ":"
        comment - - the String in the configuration File that is used to start a comment, such as "#"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - if reading or writing the configuration File fails
